text: Kathleen Joan Heddle, (November 27, 1965 - January 11, 2021) was a Canadian rower. She won two gold medals at the 1992 Summer Olympics and 1996 Summer Olympics. Heddle also won a bronze medal in 1996. In 1997, Heddle was awarded the Order of British Columbia and was honored into the Canadian Sports Hall of Fame. Heddle was born in Trail, British Columbia. Heddle died on January 11, 2021 in Vancouver, British Columbia from breast cancer and lymphoma, aged 55. ==References== Category:1965 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for Canada Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Canada Category:Canadian rowers Category:Medalists at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:People from Trail, British Columbia Category:Sportspeople from British Columbia
title: Kathleen Heddle
